task.title: Set Access Permissions
task.shortdesc: Follow these steps to set the access levels for each user on your memories.

context.p: User access to translation memories content is controlled by setting access permissions. The access rights a user can have for a given translation memory are:
The following table summarizes the actions allowed to a user that has been granted access to a database:

strow.stentry:
Use the translation memory in Swordfish or RemoteTM's REST API for the following tasks:
TM matches retrieval
Concordance searches
Terms retrieval
Term searches

ul.li: Import TMX files using RemoteTM´s web interface.
Import TMX files using Swordfish or RemoteTM's REST API.
Select the translation memory as write-enabled database in Swordfish or RemoteTM's REST API for storing segments at translation time.
Export the translation memory as TMX using RemoteTM´s web interface.
Export the database as TMX using Swordfish or RemoteTM's REST API.

context.p: Users with "System Administrator" privileges can set access permissions for any translation memory.
Users with "Project Manager" privileges can set access permissions for any database they own.

step.cmd: Select a memory on the main list by clicking on it.
Click the Set Access button on the main toolbar.
step.stepresult: The Set Access dialog appears: Set Acces Dialog

step.cmd: Click on the checkboxes next each user ID to set the desired permission levels for that user.
Click on the Set Access button.
